Show Overview

Welcome Back, Carter

Airs: 07/10/09

Show Summary

Edit Summary »

Small town. Big secret.

A car accident leads U.S. Marshal Jack Carter into the top-secret Pacific Northwest town of Eureka. For decades, the United States government has relocated the world's geniuses to Eureka, a town where innovation and chaos have lived hand in hand.

Eureka is produced by NBC Universal Cable Studio and filmed in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada.

A car accident leads U.S. Marshal Jack Carter into the top-secret Pacific Northwest town of Eureka. For decades, the United States government has relocated the world's geniuses to Eureka, a town where innovation and chaos have lived hand in hand.

Fans' Reviews

+Review This Show More Reviews »
  •  
    9 Superb

    Lighter side of sci-fi hide « show »

    Eureka is the yin to X-file's yang. It isn't really looking to compete with the dramatic sci-fi shows but, rather, a sitcom version that's like popping Barney Fife on board the Enterprise. The elite genius creme-de-la-creme sometimes miss the obvious due to overthinking aspect of higher science. Furthermore, much of the science isn't weapons grade, military use only. It's simply, if unbelievably, the day to day application that falls in line with what average humans would enjoy in the future. For example, would we have believed in the mid-80s that we would give up our huge ghetto-blaster sound systems for the tiny I-pod? Our Atari Pac-man for X-box 360 Bio-shock? Our TV shows for webisodes? It's the next step in bringing sci-fi to those who doesn't like sci-fi or don't understand the appeal. Casting is good, not stellar, and gives characters who perhaps seems a bit blase about certain things. For example, I think that Allison is far too much the straight man. I'm not a huge fan of hit and miss love connections and this sort of show simply cannot help but fall back on such trivial nonsense. It gives the science a counter balance if it doesn't give the "hook" it is meant to.
    Do you agree?
      0 0
    Report Abuse
    mama1974 Added 5 days ago All my reviews
  •  
    10 Perfect

    Eureka is #3 on our top 12 list for current sci-fi shows. hide « show »

    Eureka is #3 on our top 12 list for current sci-fi shows. The shows writers have found a way to incorporate many of science fiction's greatest classical concepts while creating some of the most likeable and interesting characters. The show shifts from humor one week to serious drama the next. Eureka's Characters are the shows most valuable asset, casting has proved itself with the wonderful chemistry that is shared by them even during the most dificult alternate reality episodes, requiring major shifts in their acting styles. Through it all cast, writers, producers, effects and crew they pull it off flawlessly.
    Do you agree?
      2 0
    Report Abuse
    top12bestcom Added May 19, 2009 All my reviews
  •  
    9 Superb

    Silly but loveable and entertaining hide « show »

    I am so glad to hear the rest of season three will be coming this summer. Eureka is a sweet, funny, loveable show. I love the computerized artificially intelligent house named SARAH (Self Actuated Residential Automated Habitat) that Sheriff Carter and his daughter Zoe live in. I like the the use of the lush green B.C. backdrop that it's filmed against. The cast is pretty good, and the actor that plays sheriff Carter is quietly charismatic. One of those modest, understated but consistently courageous and resourceful types of heroes. An odd man out in a community of hyper intelligent oddballs - turns out even his daughter is of the supersmart variety. This is a feel good show - looking forward to some lighthearted fun viewing with its return.
    Do you agree?
      2 0
    Report Abuse
    sramv9 Added May 18, 2009 All my reviews
  •  
    9.2 Superb

    Scientists gone wild. hide « show »

    To live in Eureka, one must assume a devil-may-care attitude. Away from the prying eyes of the public, the scientists here are given free rein. Experiments which would appear dangerous and/or illegal to the frightened masses are quite routine in this neck of the woods. Amidst this chaos is Sherriff Carter, who arrived at the job quite by chance. It is he who is tasked with keeping the sidewalks of the town both hoverboard and missile free. He balances this work and single father status, raising a teenage daughter in his modern, if rather rude home. Eureka may be a small town, but there are exciting things going on in this community. Those with the good fortune to slip past the dogcatcher will be highly rewarded. My first stop would be the local diner.
    Do you agree?
      0 0
    Report Abuse
    Sirius452 Added May 14, 2009 All my reviews

    9.5 Superb

    Eureka is a great series, and my friends cannot get enough of the shows on the Sci-Fi channel. Even friends that do not have cable come over to watch and comment on the series when it is on. Would like to see more on deputy sheriff Jo Lupo and Fargo. hide « show »

    What can I say about the characters?
    Jack Carter saves the day every episode.
    Jo Lupo is a gun nut with feelings.
    Taggart is somewhat crazy at the best of Times.
    Allison Blake as love interest with Jack Carter.
    Zoe Carter, needs more interaction with her peers.
    Vincent needs more substance.
    Douglas Fargo is great, need more work on him.
    Spencer needs a girlfriend.
    Henry needs a new girlfriend too.
    This show needs more science in each episode as well as when things go wrong. It would be great in the store bought DVD's that the location of the original town in the pilot be indentified. We need a 4th season fast, and presumeably a 5thm 6th, 7th season as well.
    Do you agree?
